column4: Ok I have a ? about security....running Lucid firestarter has logged like 8 intrusion attempts...From China...so how do I make sure they are not getting in??
What other methods of security can I take to prevent Intrusions or is firestarter pretty safe??
you should be ok unless you added some server software like apache, ftp etc..  try  netstat -antuwp | egrep "(^[^t])|(^tcp.*LISTEN)"
what will that command do??
test for listening port
you will have 'some' internal stuff, which can be ignored.
is there any extra measures I can take to insure they dont get in??
also, fo you have a router/nat or connected direct to the net?
switch off..
for the time being I am connected direct thru eth
they need something to 'get in' to first, so make sure nothing is listening.
there are online port scanners also to try.
but linux+firewall is sufficient.
checking grc.com right now
can I send you the log file and have you see if you can figure out who is trying to get in ??
I wouldnt worry about it..  make sure nothing is sat waiting for a knock knock and you`ll be right.
ok well grc showed all green as far as stealth goes but replied to ping request...how do i turn that off or modify what the ping request replies to??
thats a setting in some file somewhere I cant remember, maybe someone else can remember for me :)
ping is nothing to fear
doesnt your firewall have something for it?
I will check but I am running firestarter
